content.text:
# Vaibhav Pawar

| birth_place         = Barghat, Madhya Pradesh, India
| nationality         = Indian
| occupation          = Politician
| spouse              = Dr. Neelam Pawar
| parents             = D.S. Patle
| office              = State President of the Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha
| term_start          =
}}
Vaibhav Pawar (born 23 August 1988) is an Indian politician and RSS swayamsevak. He became President of Bhartiya Janata Yuva Morcha (BJYM) in the state of Madhya Pradesh on 13 January 2021.
Early life
Vaibhav Pawar was born on 23 August 1988 to Lata Pawar Patle and D.S. Patle in Barghat, a town Seoni district in the Indian state of Madhya Pradesh. He graduated from Rajiv Gandhi Proudyogiki Vishwavidyalaya with a Bachelor of Engineering in Electronics and Communication Engineering. He later pursued an MBA in Urban Rural Management and Human Resources from Barkatullah University.
Career
Pawar was an active member of Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP) and was elected as Bhopal Metropolitan Technical Student Head in 2007-08 and Bhopal Metropolitan Minister in 2009-10 and 2010–11. He dedicated eight years to student council before resigning as the Bhopal Department Convenor in 2011–12.
In 2012, he joined Bhartiya Janata Party (BJP) and served as State Executive Member of Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha (BJYM). He actively contributed to the Bharatiya Janata Party campaign for the 2014 Indian general election. Pawar expanded his influence by working in the Balaghat-Seoni Lok Sabha constituency and participating in the Khandwa Lok Sabha constituency.
In 2017, he was selected as Vice President of Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha for Madhya Pradesh and helped organise the BJP Youth Volunteering program. He was the divisional in-charge of Yuva Morcha Madhya Pradesh and organized meetings in 38 assembly constituencies.
Pawar serves as State President of Bhartiya Janta Yuva Morcha.
Personal life
Pawar married Dr Neelam Bisen on 6 July 2021.
